description: North America is the third-largest continent by area and fourth-largest by population. It is home to diverse landscapes, including vast forests, deserts, and mountain ranges.
examples: United States, Canada, Mexico, Cuba, Jamaica.

description: South America is the fourth-largest continent, located mostly in the southern hemisphere. It is known for its rich biodiversity, including the Amazon Rainforest, and diverse cultures.
Europe is the second-smallest continent by area but densely populated. It is known for its rich history, diverse cultures, and architectural landmarks.
examples: France, Germany, United Kingdom, Italy, Spain.

description: Asia is the largest continent both by area and population, spanning diverse landscapes from deserts to tropical rainforests. It is known for its ancient civilizations and cultural diversity.
examples: China, India, Japan, Russia, Saudi Arabia.

description: Africa is the second-largest continent by area and population, known for its vast savannas, deserts, and diverse wildlife. It has a rich cultural heritage and history.
examples: Nigeria, Ethiopia, Egypt, South Africa, Kenya.

description: Australia is the smallest continent and a country itself, located in the Southern Hemisphere. It is known for its unique wildlife and natural landmarks.
examples: Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, Fiji, Indonesia.
